text: Red pulls up out front, tires crunch softly on the gravel driveway. It’s a WOODEN HOUSE nestled amongst the trees at the end long, winding dirt road. The porch light is on. Moths flutter around it. RED gets out of the truck toting and grabs his duffel bag Heads towards the house. INT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - NIGHT 7 Red and Mandy built this house together over the course o couple of years out of the ruins of an old cabin.  6. It’s a cozy two story wooden structure with lots of windo and they love it. It’s theirs. One of her best works hangs framed above the couch. An incredibly detailed and beautiful drawing of a fantastica landscape dominated by a Hydra. Red comes in. Drops his gear on the floor. He looks into the living room and sees Mandy hunched over kitchen table drawing. She’s wearing a big pair of headph and her glasses. Lost in another world. A record spins silently on the stereo.

Yo. I’m home. Mandy is startled she pulls of her headphones and spins around. Mandy. Small town girl to the core. Hard upbringing. She exudes a bruised charm. A long thin scar runs down her le cheekbone. She’s been through hell but her eyes are open exude warmth and intelligence. We can tell right away she the kind of woman we’d want to hang out with.
Red! You scared the hell out of me! Red apologizes with a look.
Knock knock.
Who’s there?
Eric Estrada.
Eric Estrada who?
Eric Estrada from Chips. She smiles and shakes her head.

INT. RED & MANDY’S HOME, BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT 8 A warm, soft light flows in ILLUMINATING the scene. We are looking down at RED AND MANDY lying in bed naked u a knitted blanket. The light in the room is dim and warm. We slowly glide down towards them as they talk. Quietly, intimately and softly. Red lights a smoke with his Zippo passes it to Mandy. Lights another for himself.
How was your day?
Pretty good. I was reading that book about the galaxy.
That big thick one?
Yeah... it’s pretty awesome.
What’s your favorite planet?
Jupiter. No doubt.
How come?

The surface of its atmosphere is a storm that’s been raging for thousands of years... and the eye of that hurricane is so huge it could easily swallow up the whole Earth. I think that’s my favorite planet.
Wild...
What’s your favorite? Red thinks for a moment.  10
Saturn probably.
Yeah... I like Saturn. It was one of the first planets we humans discovered... so there’s lots of ancient myths about it. Red thinks for a moment.
I changed my mind...
What?!

I like GALACTUS... cause he eats planets! She smiles. He kisses her. She snuggle closer in the warm dim light. EXT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - NIGHT 9 Slowly we leave the warm little house tracking up INTO TH NIGHT SKY. It’s alive with STARS. Soft puffy clouds move by slowly . pass by them into the blanket of stars. Lush with colors shifting as the galaxy seems to sigh.

RED and MANDY speed down a forest road in the BRONCO. Red the wheel. MANDY leans out the open window. She’s wearing a t-shirt, cutoff jeans and flip flops. She smiles softly, hair whip in the wind. They zoom down the wide forest road towards the lake. The ROAR of wind and engine fills the soundtrack.  11 12 13 The sunlight passes through the trees on her face.

RED AND MANDY are on a ROW BOAT out on the lake. They rel drying off in the warm sunlight. RED has his fishing pole rigged up and jutting over the s waiting for a catch. They look happy. Drifting. We zoom slowly out until we are at a Wide high angle. The little boat floats there with them in it, far away.

Red sits by the fire of their camp site by the lake, stok it with a stick. He looks over. Just at the edges of the fire light Mandy swimming in the dark glassy water.  14 15 10. Red goes back to tending the fire. Smoke dangling from hi mouth. A moment passes. Red looks up again. Mandy’s Theme begins to shimmer on th soundtrack. Mandy is emerging from the lake. Her body glistening in t light of the fire. Her long hair falling about her bare shoulders. Here and now she looks like a goddess of pure sensuality. Their eyes meet. The smoke drops from his mouth. She moves towards him.
RED is asleep. Mandy is lying there wide awake. The ashes the fire smolder. Tree branches sway in a gentle breeze. She closes her eyes. A faint eerie SOUND in the breeze.

EXT. LAKE, FOREST —- DAWN 15 MANDY walks under the shifting dark shadows of the pine trees. She sees a pool of bright light and moves toward it. Emer into a clearing. The air is thick with pollen and insects and dandelion se float in the wind. No trees here, only waist high grass. The world and MANDY seem to be one. The sunlight on her f this bloom of light soaked green, the calls of birds. She spies bent grass, folded over, a trail in the clearin A faint BUZZING can be heard. She walks forward.  16 17 11. The warmness of the scene begins to FADE gradually replac BUZZING SOUND. On the edge of the clearing, in the musty shade there is LARGE HOLLOW LOG.

And there, the CARCASS OF A STILLBORN DEER ROTTING at the base of the log. Its BLOODY GUTS hang out its distended gut. Pulsating with MAGGOTS. Flies SWARM everywhere. The sound of buzzing CONSUMES the soundtrack getting loud and LOUDER
As they DRIVE Mandy gazes out the window still haunted by what she saw in the forest.

Red and Mandy pull up in the BLAZER in front of the one s cinder block gas station just off the side of a forested road. They get out. Mandy heads into the store to grab some stuff and Red sta filling up the Bronco with fuel. Silently behind Red a POLICE CAR pulls up. ANGLE on the passenger seat: A PORN MAG with the three ca left of a SIX PACK straddling it. The door of the car opens. A man gets out. SHERIFF BARREL a large brutal John Wayne wannabe. There’s something off about him. A sadism in his eyes.  He notices Red and starts coming over.

Well, well, well, if it isn’t Red Miller. 12. Red recognizes the voice and his eyes immediately colden. Barrel kicks the tires on the Bronco. SHERIFF BARREL (cont'd) This thing insured? Red stays put.
Just filling up that’s all.
I could cite you for that... but you're lucky I’m in a good mood today. Red bites his tongue.
Thanks Sheriff.

Say, I hear you’re shacked up... Barrel looms closer. SHERIFF BARREL (cont'd) ...with that little slut Mandy Bloom. Red slowly TURNS AROUND TO FACE HIM. Barrel is enjoying t SHERIFF BARREL (cont'd) Seems to me she fucked pretty much anything with a heartbeat in this town at one time or another. Kinda hard to believe she’s all married like to just one man. What with all the... fucking... and sucking... she likes to do... so much. Mandy watches from inside as she pays, concerned  13. Red is staring at Barrel. His eyes are cold. He is keepin in check. But inside he is boiling with rage. SHERIFF BARREL (cont'd) But when you think about it you make a perfect couple. A whore and loser drunk... why you were practically made for each other. Red’s hand has unconsciously closed into A FIST. Red looks down. Barrel has his hand resting casually on his REVOLVER. SHERIFF BARREL (cont'd) You may be keeping your shit together... for now... but a loser drunk like you is gonna fuck up sooner or later... it’s only a matter of time. Isn’t that right... Red. We hear the door jingle and Mandy comes out carrying a shopping bag. She sees something’s up and pauses.
What’s going on... Barrel looks her up and down.
I was just leaving. Have a nice day now. Barrel turns and trudges back towards his patrol car. Mandy comes over to Red. She puts her hand on his arm.
Hey.... Once Barrel is gone Red relaxes a bit... MANDY (cont'd) What was that all about?  18 INT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME The TV is filled with static.
Nothing. Sound low. 14.

Red and Mandy lie asleep on the couch. Mandy’s head rests his chest. One of Mandy’s most beautiful pieces is framed and hangin the wall above them. Red shifts a bit restlessly. Dreaming. Bad dreams. Mandy’s eyes open. She’s been thinking. Red stirs.
Red... You awake?
Yeah baby... What is it...
You okay?
Yeah why...
You were having a bad dream.
Uh huh...
What about? Red thinks about it.
I can’t remember... Sometimes wonder if we should move away this place.
from
Where?
I don’t know...
I like it here Red... it’s peaceful... our little home... Red smiles a little. Mandy’s eyes drift, remembering something.
Did I ever tell you about the Starlings... From when I was a girl?
No... I don’t think so... Mandy’s eyes are a little sad.

In the neighborhood where I grew up there were Starlings everywhere. In all the trees. Chirping and playing and flying around. They were so cute. But our neighbor, he hated em. They were always eating the cherries from his cherry trees. One day me and a bunch of the other kids from the neighborhood were playing in this empty lot. He came walking over with a pillow case and a crow bar. There was something moving in the pillow case... like squirming. He made us all gather round, said he had something to show us. We all gathered round and he dumped what was in the pillow case onto the ground. It was a bunch of baby Starlings. Told us he was gonna show us how to kill em. He lifted up the crowbar and brought it down right on the little baby bird... so hard it pushed it right into the ground... it was deep in there... like a little grave...  19 20 16. MANDY (cont'd) he handed the crowbar to one of the kids and they all took turns... killing a starling each...
What’d you do...
I just watched... but when it came my turn to go... I ran away. Red squeezed Mandy to comfort her.

Come here... Mandy looks up at Red. Mandy's eyes fill with tears and she smiles. Red is choki up a little too, and smiling. They embrace each other. FADE OUT. EXT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - DAY 19 CLOSE on a LOG being SPLIT with a hard crack. RED is CHOPPING WOOD near the house. His shirt’s off and see that he has a few of what appear to be rough and fade prison tattoos. He places one log after another on a stump and brings the down splitting fire wood. This is therapy for him. INT/EXT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - KITCHEN - YARD - DAY 20 MANDY is cutting up an apple. She slices up her thumb. Flinches.

Godammnit. She bats the slices into the sink.  17. She holds up her thumb and inspects it. A large droplet o blood forms at the cut. Mandy puts her thumb to her mouth and licks it off. Mandy grabs a fresh full apple from a bowl and karate kic open the back door. As she approaches Red senses her and wedges the axe into chopping block. Wipes the sweat from his brow as he turns around.
Hi there...
Hi...
That for me?
Maybe. Red smiles.
Thanks. She’s hesitates.
Red...
Yeah?
Why do you never talk about... you know... your life before we met? Red gets distant. But he suddenly lights up.
I’m an introvert. He’s deflecting but she lets it slide. She can’t help but smile. He’s lovable.
Well that explains it.  21 18. He grins.
Well... I’m gonna smoke a bowl... then head over to work in a bit.

That’s how to do it. Mandy tosses him the apple and heads back towards the hou As he watches her go we can see Red regrets not opening u her. He bites into the apple. INT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - DAY 21 Stoned, Mandy reclines on the couch reading her thick dog eared paperback. The name of the novel is ‘Seeker of the Serpents Eye’ by Lenora Tor. Her sketchbook lays open on the coffee table. The pages L with ideas. The evil looking pipe and a Zippo next to it. Her eyes move dreamily over the pages of the novel... Close on the printed words. The ink bleeding gently into pulpy paper stock. As Mandy reads...

text: MANDY is walking down the road through the FOG in a summe dress and flip flops. She looks luminous in the strange l of the summer MIST. A Blood Crystal hangs around her neck a chain. Out of its depths of the mist in eerie slow motion EMERGE A LONG CAB CAMPING VAN, 1977 FORD CHATEAU. CRUISING down stretch of paved road surrounded by thick forest and tall cliffs. The sequence is cut to the song. RIDING IN THE VAN ARE -- THE CHILDREN OF THE NEW DAWN. Le the “Legendary” JEREMIAH SAND. They're dressed casually like “cool” camp counselors. Wol in sheep’s clothing. Driving the VAN is BROTHER SWAN. 40. Sand’s conniving and viper like right hand man. We are introduced to the rest of the group -- sitting in back are SISTER RIVER -- 16. Face like a broken doll. She’s the "daughter" of Sand and Mother Marlene -- and so much more Her pretty wavy hair looks like it gets a brushing every  20. BROTHER KLOPEK -- 35. A seven foot tall ghoul of a man wi bowl haircut. His eyes are dim but his capacity for cruel is untold. BROTHER HANKER -- 28. An aging juvenile delinquent who ha finally found a family. He is deceptively unassuming and fiercely loyal to Sand. SISTER LUCY -- 30. Scrawny blank eyed acid casualty with stringy hair. The "crazy" one. TWIN LEWIS AND TWIN LAWRENCE. Pudgy, sullen twins in thei early 20s. They’re very new to the “family” and still wid eyed tourists. MOTHER MARLENE -- 44. Sand’s “wife”. She has the sad dist eyes of a woman who has been forgotten. But cruelty is in blood. She looks over at JEREMIAH SAND. 59. Their leader. Riding in the passenger seat. He seems drugged. Decadent. His skin as tanned and leathery as George Hamilton. His bleach blond, almost whi hair permed into an absurd but sinister curls. He carries himself with vanity and arrogance but there is also a ver old bitterness seething in his piercing blue toned eyes. The VAN CREEPS SLOW down the dirt road.

Mandy walks lost in a daydream. SAND lazily turns his head and something catches HIS EYE. BLOOD CRYSTAL hanging around her neck GLINTS in a stray sunbeam. The red gliting light flashes. His sickly gaze slides up from the crystal along her body her face. She wipes sweat from her brow with her forearm. Sand becomes by her and WHEN HE DOES the soundtrack is CONSUMED by a nocturnal, rising ORCHESTRAL SWELL of CATACLYSMIC EMOTION. The VAN passes her. CLOSE on SAND. His eyes are LOCKED on MANDY as they move towards her, but she’s oblivious to his presence.  23 24 21. We LINGER on Mandy through his eyes GLIDING up her body barely concealed beneath the light cotton dress. And up t her face, her hair moving gently in the breeze. Mandy happens to look up and their eyes meet. Only for a moment. Locked together in an abysmal eternity. At first seems fine but slowly her eyes become unsettled. Sands tongue glides across his dry lips. Then she’s gone. He watches her in the rear view disappea into the fog. We HOLD CLOSE on SAND as they drive away, his eyes wellin with a strange and horrible new NEED. THE ORCHESTRAL WAVE continues to rise as we
Letters move across the screen overlapping and bisecting like the title sequence of THE DEAD ZONE. Behind the colo of a KALEIDOSCOPE shifting and turning gently.

text: Silence. Mandy is behind the counter at the small general store where she works, reading her book. We hold on her f moment. The soft sound of the AC and the turning pages of book. She's startled by a voice. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) I really like your dress. Mandy looks up. Across from her is MOTHER MARLENE carryin basket with a couple of items in it. In this context Moth Marlene looks positively friendly and maternal.  22. Mandy smiles.
Well, thanks.
Whatcha reading?
A novel.
How do you like it?

I love it! I think it’s Lenora Tor’s best book. Mother Marlene puts a couple of tomatoes on the counter a couple of boxes of mac and cheese and a packet of hot dog buns. Mandy starts ringing them through and bagging them.
You have such lovely tomatoes around here.
That's the best thing about living in the middle of nowhere.
I used to grow my own... now I just buy em at the store. It’s not the same.
Me and Red are hoping to build a green house soon.
Who’s Red, your Daddy?
My boyfriend.
Oh yeah... what’s he do?  23.
He’s a sawyerman. Marlene gives her a quizzical look.
Like a logger.
Ooh! They laugh a little.
Must be a pretty tough guy.
Yeah sure... I guess.
You grow up around here?
I grew up just outside Beaver Valley, but I came here when I was about 16. Ran away to the “big city”. Mandy laughs her eyes shining. Mother Marlene laughs too, studying her.
I guess you live around here?
Yeah we live down near Crystal Lake.
That sounds lovely.
Yeah it’s pretty nice. I like it anyway.  24. MANDY (cont'd) Mandy is starting to get weirded out.
It’s good to have a strong man to look after you.
I suppose...
Well good luck with the green house.
Thanks. Mother Marlene collects her bag.
Bye now. Have a nice day.

See ya later. MOTHER MARLENE exits, the door jingling. The friendly loo her face slowly fading as she walks away. Mandy watches her go. * The VERY OLD LADY who owns the store pokes her head out f behind a shelf. *
Who was that? *
Nobody. *
Okay. * A little uneasy, Mandy gets back to reading her book. *

Sand and Marlene lie in bed in a dim seedy motel room. Th door to the smoky adjoining room is ajar and we can see t rest of The Children hanging out in there watching TV and milling about.  25. Sand is moping into his pillow. Marlene puts her hand on shoulder.
What’s the matter Jeremiah? Are you alright? When Sand speaks - his voice is reedy and soft.
No. I’m not alright.
But why? Did I do something wrong?
Wrong? Everything you do is wrong. The last time you did something right was so long ago I can’t even remember what you doing something right looks like.
I’m so sorry Jeremiah. Is there anything I can do to make you feel better?
There is nothing that you can do. It’s her. I feel naked without her. Naked. Do you hear me?
I said... do you hear me?
Yes, Jeremiah. I hear you.
(mimicking her) Yes, Jeremiah. I hear you. Mother Marlene winces.
Really? Because sometimes I don’t think you hear anything at all. I’m truly worried about that.  26.
Jeremiah... I... Sand sighs deeply.
Please just be quiet and go fetch me Brother Swan.
Okay... I’1l -- Sand’s entire body tenses and constricts. Marlene pulls a instinctively.

I. Said. Go. Fetch. Me. Bruh-ther. Swannnn. Mother Marlene slides carefully off the bed and into the other room. A moment later Brother Swan comes in. He walks quietly ov to the bed and kneels down close to Sand. Jeremiah’s eyes are closed. He opens them and sees Swan. body relaxes.
Ahhhh. There you are. Swan looks at Sand with total respect and admiration.
What can I do for you Jeremiah?
I need you to get me that girl. I need her. I need her now.
I will.
Do whatever it takes. Leave nothing to chance. I need this.
Consider it done, Jeremiah.  27.

Bring me the Horn of Abraxas. Swan digs through a duffel bag and pulls out a gnarled wo box. Inside swaddled in cloth is an OBJECT. Swan hands the object to Sand who gently parts cloth REVEALING an eleven inch HORN. Twisted Ceylon Ebony. Intricately carved. It feels cursed to the glance. Swan's eyes widen at the rare sight of it.
You know what to do.
Yes... Swan nods. He takes The Horn of Abraxas reverently. It’s attached to a leather cord and he hangs it gently around neck.
I knew I could count on you. Sand reaches out and caresses Swan’s face tenderly.
I can always count on you... buddy. Swan reaches over and clasps Sand’s hand.
Thank you Jeremiah. Nothing gives me greater pleasure. Swan gets up.
Good. Before you go, send in Sister River. I need something pretty to play with.
Yes Jeremiah. I will. Swan goes into the other room. We hear talking. A moment later Sister River is ushered in. River shrinks towards t bureau trying not to be noticed.  26 28.
River... Come over here... Let me see you. River walks over and climbs on to the bed and Jeremiah wr his arms around her. He pushes his face into her neck and hair, smelling her.
You smell so good.
Jeremiah cruelly clutches her hair and neck. River tries to pull away but this only makes his grasp mo violent.

You shut your filthy little mouth and do not speak unless you are spoken to. Do you understand? River nods slowly her eyes filling with tears. Sand twists her face towards his and forces her mouth ope he jams his yellowed tongue into her mouth and kisses her greedily. He whispers in her ear.
I’m gonna hump you raw. Swan watches through a crack in the door.

The Children’s camper van is parked in a gnarled clearing surrounded by deep dark forest at the end of a long windi dirt road. The moon is almost full. Swan, Brother Hanker and the hulking Brother Klopek get o and look around. Swan looks nervous.
You sure this is the right place?  29.

Yes of course I am. Swan hesitantly raises The Horn of Abraxas to his lips. He pauses then he begins to play. A strange, eerie series notes. Swan lowers the flute and glances into the dark, frighten He raises the horn and plays the notes two more times. The sound echoes off into the darkness seeming to take on life of its own within the lightless shadows.
What now?

Now we wait. We follow as Swan, Hanker and Klopek as they saunter back the van and get in. Swan slowly closes the door and the m whines and then clicks. The night is deathly silent and we can hear every tiny so Hanker adjusts his seat. It creaks. Swan rolls down the drivers side window. Each turn of the hand crank grinding and whining. Klopek breaths audibly through his mouth like a dog. Swan leans back. Caresses The Flute nervously. A few moments pass as we sit here with them listening to Klopek breath. Swan staring into the darkness with anticipation. Then -
How long do we -
Shhh! Swan looks out the window.

Listen.  30. In the distance we hear the sound of faint - ROARING. GUTTURAL ENGINES - and they are approaching. Slowly they louder and louder - Swan nods to Hanker who grabs a knapsack. They get out of van and stand waiting. Within a breath A PACK OF FIVE MOTOR BIKES, MATTE BLACK BOBBERS, roar into the clearing kicking up dust and revvi their engines at an infernal volume. Then slow to a crawl and stop about twenty feet from the They are driven by shadowy figures dressed entirely in bl Leather. Aberrant road armor. Long Stringy hair. Dark helmets. These are THE BLACK SKULLS. Skin as pale as the surface o the moon. More like Harkonnen marauders than a biker gang As much demons as men. SKRATCH, the leader, his polished metal helmet has eyes painted on it’s opaque face plate. He appears to be BLIND SCABS, his rotting greasy haired leftenant. SPIDER, a spi rail thin demon. FUCK PIG a slovenly fat beast, but with powerful build of a sumo wrestler. (He alone rides a modi QUAD WHEEL ATV). Scabs’ bike has a sidecar. In it sits a strange female skull - SIS. Head hung. Face obscured by l greasy black hair. She clutches a shotgun. Their bodies glistening as if soaked in motor oil. But they appear shadowed and enshrouded and we never get a clear look at them. Ever. THE BLACK SKULLS. Hell spawned super freaks playing out a ritual only they can understand. They kill their engines and the clearing is suddenly eeri silent. Lit now only by the light of the moon. SKRATCH dismounts and approaches. His boots crunching on stoney earthen floor. The others lurk, watching from the dark. He comes within spitting distance of Swan. Tilts his head expectantly at him. His thin black lips part into a sickly smile revealing po rotting teeth. Swan is about to speak when  31.

The Skull’s arm whips out and grabs Swan around the back the head bringing him close. Klopek begins to step up but Swan raises his hand telling to back down. SKRATCH leans in. His other hand rises. The tips of his black gloves pointy sharp. He runs the tip of his finger down Swan’s cheek drawing a thin sliver of blood.

Blood... for... blood. His teeth part and a wet tongue extrudes from within the cavern of his mouth. He licks up an engorged droplet of b from the surface of Swan’s quivering face. SKRATCH releases Swan. Cautiously Swan steps back and mot to Hanker who kneels down and unzips the backpack. From inside he extracts a sealed MASON JAR full of murky grey fluid. He hands one to Swan. Swan unscrewed the lid and cautious hands it to Skratch. Skratch takes the jar surprisingly delicately. Raises it his face and smells the fluid deeply. He licks his lips then GUZZLES it down. All of it, in two three gulps. A wave passes over him, his head falls, and he drops the empty jar to the ground. Swan watches trying to stifle his growing terror. Then the SKULL slowly raises his head. He stares into Swa eyes unfeelingly.

INT. RED AND MANDY’S HOUSE, BEDROOM/BATHROOM - NIGHT 55 Red’s eyes open. Reality comes flooding back -- Hyperventilating Red clambers into the bathroom. For a mo in the dark he struggles to breathe. He flips on the swit burning the whole room white with light.  59A. He opens the sink cabinet and digs frantically. Finds a l board. Flips it open.  56 57 60. Digs in. Pulls out a hidden bottle of Vodka. Hands shakin twists off the cap. Tears pouring down his face he chugs. Coughs. Burns. His breathing slows. He pounds almost the whole bottle. Calmer now. He looks down at his hands freshly viscous blood pouring his ravaged hands into the swirling water below. Calmer. Trancelike he pours the rest of the vodka over his head. He looks at his bloody hands. Then over into his own twis reflection. FADE OUT.

head_text.subj: A BLACK METAL DIRGE BEGINS TO THROB AND PULSE ON THE

text: In the darkness FRESH BLOOD begins to FLOW. Its tendrils reaching out through the darkness like the r of a tree. Gradually they form the TITLE CARD:
The tendrils probe and grow making the word become abstra like a LIVING BLACK METAL LOGO made of blood.

The DIRGE continues as WHITE HOT SPARKS rain through the dusty air. OUTSIDE the sky is acid white as the sun rises gazing on landscape like the unblinking eye of an unforgiving god. time has no meaning here.  61. Hands and torso BANDAGED, RED is GRINDING METAL on a benc grinder. It’s a well stocked work shed with BLACKSMITH TO small furnace, anvil, trough and vise. There’s also machi hardware and some motorcycle & car stuff. RED makes his own shit. He stops and lowers a WELDER’S SHIELD MASK. He puts the COLD BLUE LIGHT of an arc welder to CALTROPS (tire spikes). He grinds the points to a gleaming shine. THE FURNACE IS READY, glowing like a noon day in Hell. RED pours MOLTEN METAL into SMITHING MOLD. His bandaged hands shake a little with the effort but he makes do. Rivulets of metal track along the mold like contained lav Bursting into flame. FIRE is reflected like a vision of hell in his eyes. He HAMMERS red hot steel with a large SMITHING HAMMER. With each blow glowing embers fly. He dips the BLADE into a drum of water. Steam jets out li VOLCANIC ERUPTION. RED raises his newly forged weapon before him. A demonic BATTLE AXE that looks birthed from hell itself. handle curving down into a PIKE with edges of polished bloodthirsty silver. We will call it THE BEAST.

58 59 60 61 62. He inspects THE BEAST, turning it in his hands, feeling t weight and balance. He tightens leather straps to his back and chest and shea his new weapon. INT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME, BASEMENT - DAY 58 Red closes the lid of the floor freezer as we catch a bri glimpse of Lewis’s body stuffed inside. He casually light smoke. EXT. RED AND MANDY’S HOME - DUSK 59 Sporting his favorite THREE QUARTER SLEEVE BASEBALL-T, RE loads his GEAR into the back of the BRONCO. The setting s bathing the forest in blood red light. He starts the engine which murmurs like a fire. The tires on gravel as he starts out into the NIGHT -
Red drives a gnarled cigarette dangling from his lips. Th Bronco's headlights burn into the dark void ahead.

Bright blue sky blinds us. We tilt down to see Red pulling up in the BRONCO in front of a dilapidated, s baked house in the woods. Mirrored Aviators shielding his eyes. All the curtains drawn. There are a few wrecked rusting c husks and empty rusted oil drums at the edges of the long dirt driveway.

62 63. Red gets out and looks around. He walks up to the front door. He looks down at the door bell. Above it is a faded piece of grip tape with the wor “FUCK” and “OFF” written on it. Red rings the door bell -- miraculously triggering a very melodious doorbell sound from inside. No response. Red rings the melodious doorbell again. A muffled voice emanates from deep inside.
Can’t you read? Red cocks his head. Rings it again.

What the... He hears shuffling around. Something falls over and break A moment later the door opens a crack. A big, bald headed face appears in the crack. Black. The belongs to CARUTHERS. 60. Sweat stained wife beater. Dog hang around his large, weary neck. He’s low, looking up. wheelchair.
Oh it’s you... Been awhile...
I’ve come for The Reaper. Caruthers sizes up Red for a second.
Well... come on in... Caruthers rolls back into the murky depths of the house leaving the door open behind him.

Red enters and closes the door behind him.  64. The inside of Caruthers place is in, to put it politely, state of disrepair. Sunlight tries to force it’s way in through the thick fad curtains into the dim smoky air. A large, very old BLOOD HOUND lies on the dingy sofa asle It glances up lazily at Red then drifts off again. Red and Caruthers stare at each other in the living room. TV The Price Is Right with Bob Barker is playing with the sound low. Even though Caruthers has seen better days we get the distinct impression he could easily kill us with his bare hands.
You look like you fell down a long flight of stairs. In hell. Red is silent. Caruthers sizes him up.
Nice to see you too, Mister sunshine. Red glances over. On the coffee table next to Caruthers’ table are his WORKS. Hypodermic needle, bent spoon, and z lighter. Caruthers sees Red notice it.
Diabetic. Red says nothing. Caruthers gives Red a look, remembering Red knows him, gr and wheels into the kitchen.
(off screen) Yeah, it’s around here somewhere... think it’s in the kitchen... We hear Caruthers crashing around in there, knocking stuf over. Red listens impassively.  63 65.
(off screen) Oh yeah... here it is...

Red comes in. Next to the refrigerator by a dried up old and a metal bucket full of stank water is -- A WEATHERED CROSSBOW. THE REAPER. A matte black military spec assault crossbow, with a large crank lever on the right side for re-cocking drawstring. Red gives Caruthers a “thanks for taking good care of my so well” look.
It’s in perfect condition. Just like you left it.
Ever heard the expression “treat someone elses property like you'd treat your own”?

Hey... look around you man. Red picks up THE REAPER and tests the tension. It pulls n and taut. He winces as his left hand grips the handle shakily. Caruthers watches that. Red slackens. Trying not to let it show. These two strange beasts stand in the kitchen for an awkw moment.
Well, I’11 get out of your hair.
Ha ha. Real funny. Caruthers looks at Red. He can tell something’s up.  64 66.
So whattya gonna do with that thing?
I’m going hunting. This amuses Caruthers.
Oh, you’re gonna go hunting huh... well if you’re gonna go... hunting... I got some other shit you might need.
I was hoping you'd say that.

Caruthers leans over and digs through a pile of dirty lau revealing beneath it a dented war torn WEAPONS FOOT LOCKE with a padlock on it. Caruthers reaches down and efficiently enters the combo i the padlock with his thumb, unlocking it with a swift cli

Have a look... Red crouches down next to Caruthers as he swings the lid open. Inside are 2 black aluminium shafted ARROWS. The metallic tips seem custom made. Large, black, raw and lethal looki Just like Caruthers himself. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) I made em myself at Firebase Bastogne. Hand sharpened steel heads. Sharper than the gaze of god. Red looks at Caruthers.  66A.
Two arrows? What am I supposed to do with two arrows?

Shove em up your ass for all I care. Red picks one up and inspects it. Touches the serrated ed  67. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) They cut through bone like a fat kid through cake. Red turns the arrow in his hands. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) They're yours, on one condition.
Oh yeah, what’s that? Caruthers stares at Red darkly....
You put ‘em to good use.
You can be certain of that.
You sure you don’t want something... heavier?
Different tools for different jobs. Caruthers thinks Red’s lost his marbles. Red places the arrow back and sits on an old cooler. Sudd weighed down. Caruthers is realizing something heavy is u
So what you hunting? Red is consumed by horror for moment, envisioning his spiteful quarry. Then he lets it out.
Jesus freaks. Caruthers chortles incredulously.  68.
I didn’t know they were in season.

Yeah... well... Red is suddenly overcome. He sits down on an old cooler. bowed. Caruthers is getting concerned. RED MILLER (CONT’D) (very quietly) Mandy's... gone... Caruthers is shell shocked. He liked her.
I... Hey man... He can’t find the words. He wheels opposite Red. He gathers himself. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) Tell me. Red doesn't look up. He takes off his shades.
Weirdo hippy types. A whole bunch of ‘em.
This zone is lousy with em... Hard to say.
Yeah... but then there was the muscle... Didn’t make sense. Bikers. But something different about them... Caruthers chews on his stogie.
Different how?
Something like I have never seen.
You catch a patch or a cut?  69.
Nah man. There was nothing. Just... crazy... evil. Caruthers thinks it over. Takes a match to his chewed hal cigar. His countenance becomes grim.

Black Skulls. As their name is intoned Red’s eyes glisten with what can only be described as a glimmer of fear. CLOSE. Caruthers lights his stogie, puffs and smoke RISES FLAME BELLOWS before his mouth. He takes a deep drag and exhales slowly. A dark sound of doom begins humming like bad omen on the soundtrack. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) Lookit man... for a while now words been coming down from the big rigs, something dark and fearsome out there. No one knows where they came from. First it was stories from the Interstate, just rumors, that a crew was boosting trailers off big rigs with a ferocity never seen before. Leaving the truckers for dead. Prostitutes vanishing. Gutted bodies left on doorsteps. And always the same - a biker gang. Black bikes. Only seen at night. Weird shit. There’s stories, that there was a chapter that ran courier for a manufacturer of LSD. He took a disliking to them. Cooked them a special batch... And they've never been right in the head since. Travel from place to place without a trail. Nomads. Some say they’re searching for that guy. Shit’s getting spooky, people saying they live in the trees, come and go with the wind. That they commune with some dark dimension. Caruthers pauses. Freaked by his own words. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) I seen em once, man. From a distance. I wish I never did.  Red takes Caruthers 70. CARUTHERS (CONT’D) These are monsters lurking out there my man. Irrational, unable to see reality. At least as we see it. What you're hunting is rabid animals. You should go in knowing your odds ain't too good and you will probably die. this all in.
Don’t be negative. chuckles wearily under his breath.

Last I heard on the CB, they were spotted near Spirit River. This get’s Red attention, he raises his eyes. Caruthers legs. Caruthers nods knowingly. He looks down at amputated his CARUTHERS (CONT’D) I wish there was more I could do...
It’s alright. is deep in thought. He glances up. Eyes filling with darkness.
When I saw em... Those things... Were in a world of pain. But you know what the freakiest part was?
What’s that?
They fuckin’ loved it. HOLD CLOSE on Caruthers -- his eyes gleaming --

head_text.subj: A PRIMAL DRONE BEGINS TO RISE ON THE SOUNDTRACK AS WE
SETTING BEHIND THE JAGGED TOPS OF THE TREE LINE.
DARKNESS FALLS QUICKLY ACROSS THE LANDSCAPE.

text: The SOUND of ROARING MOTORCYCLE ENGINES growing from the distance like an UNHOLY DEMON’S SCREAM. In the CRIMSON LIGHT of the fading sun they emerge. The B SKULLS speeding forth on their BOBBERS. SPIDER, SCABS and FUCK PIG.

Distant, artifacted through glass. From his snipers nest in the rocks Red tracks them as the speed through the pitted rocky mountain passes of Spirit River. Red zeroes in on the straggler in the pack. Scabs. Waits a heartbeat then Squeezes the trigger on the Reaper. CARUTHERS’ BOLT cuts free from The Reaper, slicing throug the hot night air at LIGHTNING SPEED. Red watches as - The arrow PENETRATES Scab’s left check and lodges there, straight through his face, in one cheek and out the other Scabs goes to scream but his face won’t open. He loses control of the bobber and slams into a rock outc by the side of the road at full speed. The bike instantly FLIPS - a twisted metal cyclone spinni Scabs off it like a ragdoll. His body hits the pavement skidding and flipping along th blacktop. The other Skulls don’t see it happen.  66 72. Red tosses The Reaper into the Bronco, jumps in. Keys the ignition and peels out - burns down the hill at breakneck speed riding the shocks like a maniac. Scabs rolls over slowly on the asphalt, leg TWISTED. Red pulls onto the highway and GUNS IT right towards him. Then - Scabs pulls a MAGNUM 44 from his belt. Before Red sees it - he raises it and lets go a massive CANNON BLAST. The BULLET instantly SHREDS the Bronco’s front left tire. The wheel JERKS. Red loses control of the vehicle and it

head_text.subj: AS HE SEES IT COMING. WHOOPS

text: The BRONCO grinds to a halt on the asphalt. Wheels up. Red is battered and twisted in the bottom of wreck. His l is stuck. Boot caught on the shifter. He tries to pull free. Then - He hears the ROAR of the other skulls doubling back and speeding towards him. He struggles to get free as the headlights ENGULF him. FADE TO BLACK.

No sound. The sun hasn't risen yet.  72a. The light is a pale slate grey.  67 73. A dark tree line on the far side of the lake silhouetted against it. The surface of the lake is perfectly still like black gla We pan down to look at the black surface. A ghostly figure begins to rise from the depths. It is MANDY. She is bare and her skin is white and cold like porcelain Her eyes are open. She is looking at us.

Slow fade in. Red awakens in a murky room. He’s down on the floor leani against a radiator. He tries to move his arm but it’s handcuffed to an expose rusty pipe in the wall. He tries to lift his other hand. A lightning bolt of pain shoots through his system. He looks over and sees it’s nailed right to the concrete floor, palm up. Red's been stripped of his gear and is barefoot. Even tho he’s in hell he seems strangely rejuvenated. This is wher belongs now. Muffled from upstairs is an infernal sound. Music? He looks around. He hears strained whimpering.  74. Sitting by a misplaced vanity table in the corner is SPID Wiry, bald. He freebases a from metal pipe. Washes it dow with some wasp sauce. He is so beyond sanity he can barel communicate but he’s making a special effort just for Red Head down Red keeps looking around the room for angles. At 11 0’Clock is a deep CONCRETE PIT . From this angle he can’t really see what’s down there but that’s definitely where the sound of the DOGS is coming from. SPIDER turns around sliding on a pair of brass knuckles. Red watches him come. Spider punches Red HARD across the face with the brass knuckles splitting the skin on his cheek bone. A stream o blood pours down his jaw.

Ow. Spider takes off the brass knuckles and tosses them onto table. He picks up a SWITCHBLADE and opens it. Checking out the KRISS BLADE. Spider speaks. If you can call it that. His voice is hoar and raspy. Wet. Subhuman.
You... killed.... my... brother.... In the dim light Spider’s eyes are glassy with monstrous emotion.
Your brother... was a pissant. Spider kneels down grabbing Red by the scruff his neck. E wild with rage he waves the blade in his face. Jabbing it into his cheek.
Red is weary. Spider menaces him with the blade, running it across his jugular.  75.

I don’t wanna talk about it. Spider slices open Red's shirt with his switchblade. Red sighs - looks down at the ripped shirt and then up at Spider. RED MILLER (CONT’D) That was my favorite shirt, man. Spider looks at Red. A beat. He wants to laugh but he hat this guy. An involuntary smile quivers across his grotesq face. Red smiles strangely back. NOW we see Red has braced his arm against the rusty pipe applying pressure to it. Hand clasped firmly around it’s length. SUDDENLY he busts the pipe free and swings it at Spider. It impacts HARD on his sickly skull. SPIDER is shell shocked. He staggers backwards right to THE EDGE OF THE PIT. His a flailing for balance. He teeters on the brink. Red watching. They make eye cont Red blows him a soft little kiss and - Spider plummets BACKWARDS into the HOLE. His head smackin against the edge, flipping his body forward into the darkness. We hear the DOGS go MAD WITH BLOODLUST. Spider screaming they tear him apart. Red looks over at his left hand. Nailed to the floor.  68 76. He reaches over. Grabs the head of the nail and begins to pull. Agony surges through him as the rusty nail slides out of hand. The friction of metal on wood creating a horrifying sound. Finally it pulls free with a THUNK. He tosses it to the floor and arduously gets to his feet. He staggers to the edge of the pit. Looks in. In the shadows below he can see the dogs feasting on Spid body. Some of them leer up. Shadowy twisted forms, frothi at their mouths with rabid fury. Their eyes glinting in t light.

Good doggies. Red approaches the vanity. Among the costume jewelry and scattered perfume bottles is a BOX CUTTER. He grabs it. N handcuff key. Must be in the pit with Spider. He sees his TRUSTY ZIPPO amongst the clutter and pockets it. *
Red ascends a staircase up into the main house. A once qu ranch house it’s been turned into a crash pad, skulls sty

Red looks out into the garbage strewn hallway. Empty. Dim Clutching the box cutter RED crouches low. He stalks down hallway silently. Fighting the pain. Red hears a sound from behind a door slightly ajar. * He peers into the room. * Illuminated by the dim light spilling in from the hall he see An OLD MAN lying on the bed.

(whispering) Hey old man... you okay?  77. There’s no response. He open the door a little more. Light spills in. The old man has his hands tied behind his back. His eyes red from an eight ball hemorrhage. Dead. Red looks over. The old man’s AGED WIFE is bent over a ch Dress pulled up to her waist. She is also dead. A blood chilling expression frozen on her face. Red sees a family portrait on the wall and his eyes darke we realize, with him, this used to be their home. Til the Skulls took it, along with their dignity and their lives. Red slowly closes the door and moves on down the hall. Th sounds growing louder. A flickering light ahead coming from THE FAMILY ROOM. A dim ghostly light emanating from a tv: Rancid old porn blasts on a VHS tape. Also the STEREO is BLASTING at an e splitting volume some kind of deafening noise. The speake completely blown. Silhouetted by the TV light is FUCK PIG, his back to Red, shoveling handfuls of cocaine into his face and snorting greedily.

RED stalks in. He creeps closer and closer. RED reaches f his knife. He’s inches from him. The man jerks, coked to the gills, like he heard somethin RED tenses and holds his breath. His hands don’t move. FUCK PIG grunts and chops out another line. He bows his head HOOVERING it up. Red moves in silently across the room towards him. As he comes up for air...

He sees Red reflected in the TV but before he has a chanc react — Red grabs him by a fistful of hair, yanks his head back leveraging him across the back of the sofa. He’s about to when FUCK PIG reaches back lightning fast and grabs Red by the and hair. He clamps down HARD and FLIPS Red OVER him and couch and back down into the coffee table which SHATTERS a million shards. A cloud of coke dust exploding into the air. Red drops the Box Cutter. He scrambles around to face Fuc Pig. We now see Fuck Pig is wearing a strap on BLADE DIDO. Red's eyes widen. Fuck Pig lunges on top of Red -- who parts his legs. The KNIFE DILDO just misses his groin and LODGES into the woo floor. Fuck Pig flails on top of Red trying to pull free. Red grasps for the box cutter. Just out of reach. Finally he grabbs it. Red swipes the BLADE across his neck. A moment of silence. Then a GEYSER of blood explodes from his severed artery bathing Red’s face in crimson. Fuck Pig flails, gurgling on top of him. Finally, his giant body twitches and goes limp. A moment of calm. Red clambers heaves the massive body off of him and gets painfully to his feet. A moment of calm. Suddenly THE TV SCREEN IMPLODES with a blast. He looks over into the kitchen and sees

SIS. Shotgun at her shoulder.  79. Dust around her nose. Gnarled mouth black with The Chemis special sauce. Staring at him. Eyes wide with rage. She goes to pump another round into the chamber but it JA Red CHARGES her. She tosses the shotgun and snatches a CARVING KNIFE off t counter. Before he knows it she is on him SLASHING WILDLY. Red tries to grab her, the knife slashing at his arms. He grabs her by the head and she starts to buck against his grasp, arms flailing violently. Suddenly there is the sickening CRUNCH of her neck breaki and she goes limp. Red lets go horrified. Her body slumps onto the floor ina twitching twisted heap and then abruptly stops moving. Red can’t move. He stares at the dead body of the woman. Lying there, hai splayed across the floor she looks a lot like

(quietly) Mandy... His eyes fill with despair. He cannot look away. He finds himself descending to the floor. He picks up the woman’s dead body and cradles her near. Caressing her hai Acid tears pouring down his face. Red takes a breath. He lays her back down. Leaden, he stands and heads into the kitchen. He looks in the corner. There’s a pair of BOLT CUTTERS. Red CLIPS the handcuff chain. It looks like the SKULLS have dumped a bunch of stuff in here. Wads of cash. Bags of drugs. Weapons. Garbage.  69 80. Tossed in the corner Red sees his duffel bag. The Reaper on the kitchen table and The Beast in the corner like a discarded mop. He puts the duffel on the table and takes inventory. Red's CALTROPS, THE REAPER and the FINAL ARROW Also his b and leather Beast harness. On the table he notices the rare and coveted JARS the SKU acquired from The Children. Red unscrews one of the jars and smells it. Recoils. He w his index finger in the jar. Raises it gently to his tong The INSTANT it makes contact - The screen EXPLODES into a GRIZZLY HALLUCINATION.

head_text.subj: A WRETCHED DEMON, ITS VISAGE A ROILING MASS OF WRITHING B
BEFORE A BOILING CRIMSON SKY. THE DEMON MELTS INTO THE
ABYSSAL MAW ABOVE AS WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL -
A RUSTY DECAYING RADIO TOWER SILHOUETTED BY THE ROILING

text: Red snaps out of the vision unable to draw a clean breath Stunned. Tears pour down his face. But - he is not afraid He KNOWS now where THE CHEMIST is, and only The Chemist c lead him to The Children. RED holsters THE BEAST to his back. Picks up THE REAPER. Still fazed by the vision.

Red needs a second wind. He scoops some of the coke off t carpet and snorts a blast. He clenches his teeth in a psychotic rictus grin. Red peers through the curtains and sees - SKRATCH standing SOLITARY in front of a RAGING ENORMOUS BONFIRE. It looks strangely, eerily peaceful.  70 81.

Red exits out the back door of the kitchen and climbs up wall onto the roof. The night is pitch black, the only light coming from the nearby bonfire. The forest surrounding the grounds is black and wet. He creeps along the rooftop until he finds a good vantage point looking down upon SKRATCH, who stands dark and monolithic before the fire. A spectre of the unsane. ANGLE on SKRATCH: We can hear a strange pulsing drone ech inside the metal chamber of his helmet. He is deep in a d trance. Worshipping the flame. Red wraps a rag around the head of the only remaining arr Soaks it in lighter fluid. Cracks his neck.

He ignites it with his zippo -- and as he does we flow in ULTRA SLOW MOTION. He mounts the SECOND bolt on The Reaper. He raises his weapon and carefully takes aim. His eyes gleaming in the light of the fire. He pulls the trigger and -— The bolt slides steady and true through the hot night air Until - The bolt PIERCES through the back of SKRATCH’S NECK and o through his larynx lodging there. The flames spread onto his body igniting his right arm an back. Red lowers The Reaper as he watches. SKRATCH twitches. Red's eyes widen as  82. Strangely SKRATCH does not turn around. He stands entranc Eerily Still. He reaches up with his right hand and pulls the bolt forw out through his neck. He drops it into the scalding dust. Red can’t believe his eyes. He FEARS this THING. Whatever is. He throws the reaper aside. He jumps off the roof - Unsheathing The Beast in mid air. He hits the ground running kicking up clouds of dust. SKRATCH slowly draws a brutal looking twelve inch HUNTING KNIFE from his belt. The flames spread from his arm onto BLADE. Red continues toward him - Eyes never leaving the blind demon. Now he is upon him. Red swings the blade - but SKRATCH back hands him across head sending him sprawling into the dirt. Shell-shocked - Red scrambles to get to his feet. SKRATCH’s head twitches. He looks towards the house. UNNATURALLY he SEES through a NARROW CRACK in the curtain the front room. He sees SIS lying there dead. His mouth opens unnaturally wide in a monstrous silent cr Red sees his chance he scrambles forward and without thinking, without hesitating - Body checks The Skull with as much speed and force as he muster using The Beast as a BATTERING RAM. SKRATCH STUMBLES BACKWARDS. Red upper cuts him with The Beast and quickly hits him ag with a kick to the chest. This sends Red reeling backwards into the dirt and SKRATC PLUNGING INTO THE RAGING FIRE.  71 83. He is completely and instantly ENGULFED by the RAGING INFERNO. Red clambers to get his bearings - rolling onto his side. beat as he catches his breath and then - A blood chilling SHRIEK emanates from within the pyre. He looks up to see -

Slowly crawling out of the fire on all fours like an anim Completely consumed by flame. Even as his body is withere away by the flames he keeps crawling forward towards Red. twitching living carcass. His movements strange. Red gets to his feet and limps to him. He raises The Beas and brings it down clean. Taking off SKRATCH’s head. Inst silence. His flaming skull rolls across the dirt and his charred smoking body finally collapses. Red kneels and pries THE BLACKENED HUNTING KNIFE from his desiccated claw. Sheaths it in his belt.

Red stands, staggers through the smoke. He looks down, sees a bent smoke lying miraculously in th dust. He picks it up sticks it in his mouth. With his DUFFLE strapped to the back -- Red mounts Fuck P gnarly JET BLACK FOUR WHEEL ATV. He starts the engine and GUNS IT. Peels out at high speed kicking up a shitstorm of dust as BURNS away from this accursed place.

The blackness is cut away by headlights in the fog. RED speeds through the darkest of nights on the QUAD. He winds along an uphill road and a valley of darkness li below. Flashes of low atmosphere NIGHT LIGHTNING STROBE - He has entered a darker, more primeval forest. The trees no longer green only glimpsed as full grey and black. GOD'S EYE VIEW as RED winds through the strange landscape

EXT. STRANGE TERRAIN, THE CHEMIST’S PLACE - NIGHT 73 Red turns off his headlights and kills the engine in STRA TERRAIN. ROLLS TO A STOP. We PAN OVER to reveal THE RUSTY DECAYING RADIO TOWER HE S IN HIS VISION. He dismounts and moves towards the small, low one story cinder block building in the distance on foot. He clutches the HUNTING KNIFE. There is a metal garage door open a few feet. Some light inside, and... a 70s novelty song emanating softly from inside. He kneels down and peers under the door. Then ducks under. INT. THE CHEMIST’S PLACE - NIGHT 74 RED rises and looks around. A large empty work space. At the far end of the room stands a wiry man wearing noth but a black vinyl apron. Slicked back hair.

Florescent tubes cast a pall over the table where he stan before his unusual lab setup. He is dipping a large uncut sheet of card stock, bare handed, in a chemical tray fill with murky grey SLIME. There are stacks of uncut sheets of Lysergic acid diethylamide on another table. Some hang from clothes pin wires. Sealed Jars with murky dark fluid on some shelves. Aquari with strange insects. To the right of the room is a VETERINARY CAGE with a MAND in it. It appears very calm. Red enters the room. His boots scraping on the linoleum floor. The Chemist keeps working. THE MANDRILL looks over at Red serenely. RED watches as the CHEMIST’S HAND moves slowly out of the tray and across the counter. His hand slides across the surface onto A LUGER with a lightning bolt inset in the handle. RED grips the handle of his KNIFE and we hear the leather creaking. THE CHEMIST registers this. His hand slides off THE LUGER. Slowly the CHEMIST reaches over and presses the stop butt on a TAPE DECK. It clicks and echoes through the room lou as the music stops.

It’s cool man... It’s cool.... Slowly THE CHEMIST turns around to face RED. He has a gau pale face. Sunken eyes. We see now that his pupils are EXTREMELY DILATED.
